title: PowerWash Simulator 2 - Cross-Play, Split-Screen, And Cross-Saves Explained

body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                PowerWash Simulator 2 is a zen experience solo, allowing you to get lost in a relaxing process of cleaning away grime for hours on end. However, it also features a multiplayer component for up to four players, so you can team up with friends to tackle some of the game's biggest and most challenging jobs together. If you're curious about what options you'll have available when doing so, here's everything you need to know about split-screen, crossplay, and cross-progression in PowerWash Simulator 2.Does PowerWash Simulator 2 have split-screen?If you and a friend are hanging out on the same couch and want to play PowerWash Simulator 2 together, you're in luck. By simply opening up the multiplayer menu and selecting "Start Split-Screen Session," you two can get started cleaning up any job you wish.

Does PowerWash Simulator 2 have crossplay?If you're hoping to play PowerWash Simulator 2 with friends on different platforms, your ability to do so will depend entirely on which platforms you're playing on. Xbox and PC players can team up with one another in multiplayer by creating a room and sharing their unique room code with up to three other players. However, those playing on PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch 2 can only team up with players on their respective platforms for now--and maybe forever.While FuturLab has hinted that they're at least considering crossplay functionality for PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch 2, nothing has been confirmed. It doesn't seem like a likely feature, especially given that this same restriction applied to the original game.Does PowerWash Simulator 2 have cross-progression?If you're the type to play a game on multiple devices, you'll run into some issues with this title. Unfortunately, PowerWash Simulator 2 does not feature cross-progression. As such, your saves won't be able to transfer between different platforms, meaning you'd need to replay the game from the beginning if you switch to a different ecosystem.As of now, there is no indication that FuturLab will add cross-progression at a later date, so just be certain the platform you choose is best suited for you and any friends you want to play with.

title: How To Unlock X52 Resonator And All Event Rewards In BO6 And Warzone
description: By     S.E. Doster   on October 16, 2025 at 12:02PM PDT                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    S.E. Doster
   on October 16, 2025 at 12:02PM PDT    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Call of Duty's The Haunting adds a new Halloween-themed event to Black Ops 6 and Warzone, letting you complete in-game challenges to unlock a special weapon, new attachment, and a few cosmetics. Here we'll guide you on how to unlock the X52 Resonator special weapon, GPMG-7 Muzzle Booster attachment, and all other rewards in the Echoes of the Dead event.The Echoes of the Dead event is live until October 23, so you have one full week to complete the challenges and unlock all eight rewards. There's also a bonus ninth reward for BlackCell pass holders.You unlock each reward by completing a challenge. There is a specific challenge for multiplayer, Zombies, and Warzone, but you only need to pick one challenge per reward. This lets you pick challenges based on your preferred mode or the level of difficulty. All of the rewards and challenges can be found below.X52 Resonator - Special weaponThe X52 Resonator is Season 6's new special weapon. This weapon looks like an alien blaster gun heavily inspired by Zombies mode. Activision describes the X52 Resonator as being a full-auto weapon with an extreme rate of fire, extended range, and high recoil.Additionally, you can customize the X52 Resonator by adding one of three unique Shard crystal attachments, with each offering a different style of attack. The Orbed Eruption Shard creates a versatile multi-shot, the Spiked Barrage Shard has a slow but lethal seven-round burst, and the Stone Escalation Shard offers a powerful charge shot.This is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Get 150 eliminationsZombies: Eliminate 500 zombies in Haunted Havoc modeWarzone: Get 25 eliminations in Zombies Royale modePredator - Finishing moveNot to be confused with the Hollywood action-horror icon The Predator, who is an operator in the CoD Season 6 battle pass, this is a finishing move called Predator that lets you call a predator drone attack on your opponent and explode them as a finishing move.This is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Finish any match with a top-three scoreZombies: Eliminate 10 Mimics in Haunted HavocWarzone: Get two eliminations without reloadingGPMG-7 Muzzle Booster - AttachmentThis is a new attachment specifically for the GPMG-7 light machine gun. This GPMG-7 Muzzle Booster is designed to improve bullet velocity and increase the rate of fire over time, but it comes at the expense of added recoil.This is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Get 50 eliminations with LMGsZombies: Get 300 zombie eliminations with LMGsWarzone: Get 5 eliminations with LMGsFor Warzone, this is probably best attempted in Casual modes.Cool Helm - Weapon charmCool Helm is a helmet-shaped weapon charm for your guns.This is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Earn 20,000 total scoreZombies: Earn 50,000 total Essence in Haunted HavocWarzone: Open 25 loot caches in Zombie RoyaleDouble XP tokenThis reward is a one-hour double XP token.The token is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Get 10 kills with lethal equipmentZombies: Kill 10 or more zombies with a single scorestreak three timesWarzone: Get a kill with lethal equipmentFor Warzone, this will be easiest to complete in Casual modes.Blast Burn - Calling cardBlast Burn is an animated calling card that turns soldiers into skeleton variants.This is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Earn five Double Kill medals (Two rapid kills) or betterZombies: Earn five Massacre medals (10 rapid kills)Warzone: Get three or more eliminations in a match two timesWeaponry - Large decalWeaponry is a large decal of a skeleton soldier surrounded by weapons.This is unlocked by completing one of the following:Multiplayer: Get 10 kills using melee weaponsZombies: Get 30 zombie kills with melee weaponsWarzone: Complete a Bounty contractToxic Metal - CamoToxic Metal is a universal camo for your weapons. It's also animated to show bullet holes appear. This is a mastery reward that is unlocked once you complete all seven of the reward challenges listed above. They can be completed in any order.Toxic Metal - BlackCell variantThis is a more colorful BlackCell variant of the Toxic Metal mastery camo. It's also animated with bullet holes.

title: Mortal Kombat 2 Movie's Opening Scene Will "Punch You In The Face"

body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                The opening sequence of next year's Mortal Kombat 2 movie will "punch you in the face" and possibly make you cry. That's according to series creator Ed Boon, who said in a new interview that every time he's watched the opening sequence, he's cried."I don't think I've seen it yet and not cried," Boon told Collider, as reported by GamesRadar. "It is intense. It punches you in the face. And it absolutely is the best way to start it, but the rest of the movie just lives up to it. It's such a powerful opening scene."That's all he had to say, so we don't know exactly what he's referring to here or how the opening sequence will do what Boon claims it will.Also in the interview, Boon said the sequel will "absolutely" live up to what fans expect, including going in on violence to earn its R rating. "We have the tournament, which is a big request from fans. It will absolutely satisfy you," he said.Mortal Kombat 2 was previously set to hit theaters on October 24 this year before Warner Bros. delayed it at the last minute to May 2026. Director Simon McQuoid said the delay was due to the film being "a victim of our own success.""Every time people have seen this movie, it's gained momentum," the director said, according to The Hollywood Reporter. "We've created a massive summer blockbuster, so I think we should all be proud of the fact that Mortal Kombat 2 and the franchise itself is going to kick off next year. Yes, we have to wait, but it's going to feel massive when it comes out."The Boys' Karl Urban is the most prominent addition to the cast of Mortal Kombat 2 as the fan-favorite Hollywood actor Johnny Cage. The cast also includes Jessica McNamee as Sonya Blade, Ludi Lin as Liu Kang, Adeline Rudolph as Kitana, and Tati Gabrielle as Jade.At New York Comic-Con this month, Warner Bros. announced that it had greenlit Mortal Kombat 3.
